channel.title: Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services Status - Incident History

item.title: Intermittent Performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Performance Degradation on EM West 1 POD

Summary: Performance degradation observed on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration, resulting in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. Currently being investigated as a top priority.

Feb 23, 04:04 PST
Investigating - We are observing performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration. This can result in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. Our team is currently investigating this issue as a top priority.

item.title: Intermittent issues with Taskflows on US east 4
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Taskflows Intermittent Issues Summary: Intermittent issues with Taskflows observed on US east 4, impacting both runtime and design-time. Active resolution in progress.

Feb 23, 03:57 PST
Investigating - We are observing intermittent issues with Taskflows on US east 4. Both runtime and design-time is impacted. We are actively working on resolving this issue.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance patch on US East 4 POD for Cloud Data Integration Taskflow
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Maintenance Patch on US East 4 POD Summary: Scheduled maintenance patch to address intermittent 502 Bad gateway error during Taskflow executions. Zero downtime update with no impact expected.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 22, 05:30 - 07:30 PST

Feb 22, 03:09 PST
Scheduled - We are applying maintenance patch on US East 4 POD. This is a zero down time update and there should be no impact to Task executions.

Please note that this patch addresses intermittent 502 Bad gateway error observed during Taskflow executions.

item.title: Emergency maintenance activity on CDGC EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Emergency Infrastructure Maintenance Activity

Scheduled emergency maintenance is ongoing for CDGC EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services, potentially causing intermittent disruptions in the search service. Updates will be provided as necessary.

Feb 22, 04:10 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 22, 04:09 PST
Scheduled - We are performing an emergency infrastructure maintenance activity on CDGC EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services between 4:10 to 4:20 AM PST. During this brief update period, you may experience intermittent disruptions when using our search service. Please note these interruptions will be temporary.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on GCP1, OCI, EMSE1, GCP-EMW2, EMC1 for Cloud Application Integration
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Deployment of Patch to Address User Interface Issues

Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying a patch to address User Interface issues encountered as part of the February Release in Cloud Application Integration. This is a zero downtime update and has no impact on running processes or services.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 22, 22:00 PST  -  Feb 23, 01:00 PST

Feb 22, 02:05 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying a patch to address User Interface issues encountered as part of the February Release in Cloud Application Integration.

This is a zero downtime update and has no impact on running processes or services.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on UK Services, Prerelease(Sandbox), Azure Canada1 POD for Cloud Application Integration and Cloud Data Integration Taskflows
item.content:encoded:

Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying a patch to address user interface issues encountered as part of the February release in Taskflow and Cloud Application Integration. This is a zero downtime update and has no impact on running jobs or services.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 22, 02:30 - 05:30 PST

Feb 22, 01:58 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying a patch to address User Interface issues encountered as part of the February Release in Taskflow and Cloud Application Integration.

This is a zero downtime update and has no impact on running jobs or services.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on February Upgraded PODs for a profile failure due to 0 size mapping metadata XML.
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Maintenance

Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on all February Upgraded PODs for Cloud Data Integration and Cloud Data Quality services to resolve a profile failure. Zero Downtime deployment; no impact on running jobs or services. Action Required: None.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 22, 01:30 - 03:30 PST

Feb 21, 23:40 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on all February Upgraded PODs for Cloud Data Integration and Cloud Data Quality services to resolve a profile failure due to 0 size mapping metadata XML. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and will not impact running jobs or services.

Action Required: None.

item.title: Azure DB Maintenance affecting all services on EM Central 1 Azure
item.content:encoded:
```html

[Tag(Medium)] - Azure Database Maintenance

Summary: Microsoft Azure will be performing maintenance on an Azure hosted database, resulting in brief interruptions for all services. It is recommended not to run critical jobs during this time or to schedule a blackout period.

```

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 2, 17:00 - 18:30 PST

Feb 20, 21:27 PST
Scheduled - Microsoft Azure will be performing maintenance on an Azure hosted database which is utilized by IDMC Cloud Services. During this 90 minute maintenance window, there will be database restarts resulting in brief interruptions for all services.

Attention: We recommend not running critical jobs during this time or scheduling a blackout period during this maintenance event. https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/current-version/organization-administration/schedules/configuring-a-blackout-period.html

Any Questions ? Please contact Global Customer Support - https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html

item.title: Azure DB Maintenance affecting all services on AP NorthEast 1 Azure
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 27, 10:00 - 11:30 PST

Feb 20, 21:15 PST
Scheduled - Microsoft Azure will be performing maintenance on an Azure hosted database which is utilized by IDMC Cloud Services. During this 90 minute maintenance window, there will be database restarts resulting in brief interruptions for all services.

Attention: We recommend not running critical jobs during this time or scheduling a blackout period during this maintenance event. https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/current-version/organization-administration/schedules/configuring-a-blackout-period.html

item.title: Minor Maintenance on IICS NA East 2 Services POD for API Manager
item.content:encoded:
Feb 21, 01:59 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 21, 01:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 21, 00:08 PST
Scheduled - API Manager service will be undergoing a minor maintenance on NA East 2 Services . During this maintenance window, API Manager UI will be partially available for a period of 30 minutes. API Gateway and API invocations are not impacted during this maintenance and will continue to be available along with all other services.

item.title: February 2024 standard release for US West 5, US East 6, US West 3 Azure and Canada Central 1
item.content:encoded:
Feb 20, 23:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 20, 19:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 13, 16:04 PST
Scheduled - Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) February 2024 standard release.

Connectors being updated:

Hadoop Files V2
Hive Connector
FileProcessor
Adobe Experience Platform
ServiceNow
Salesforce
IBMMQ
Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse
Google BigQeury V2
Snowflake Data Cloud Connector
DataBricks Delta
SAP ODP Extractor
SAP ADSO Writer
AribaV2
SAPTableConnector
SAP BW Connector
DnBCDIConnector ( Partner connector )

Packages being updated :

SAP Idoc
CCIAgent
ConnectorService

Platform Services are being updated.
Cloud Data Quality and Cloud Profiling are being updated.
MDM Multidomain SaaS, Customer 360 SaaS, Reference 360 SaaS, and Product 360 SaaS are being updated.
Cloud Mass Ingestion Files, Database, Application, and associated agent service for each are
being updated.
Cloud Data Integration is being updated.
Cloud Application Integration is being updated and there is no new package for Process Server.
Cloud Data Integration for PowerCenter is being updated.

item.title: Serverless agents were in failed state on IICS Canada Central 1 POD.
item.content:encoded:
Feb 20, 22:19 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 20, 22:17 PST
Investigating - We have observed that some of the serverless agents on IICS Canada Central 1 Services were in a failed state from 9:35 PM to 10 PM PST. The issue is resolved and the jobs should be running successfully now.

item.title: Platform external SSL certificate renewal for IICS AP NorthEast 2 Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 20, 11:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 20, 07:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 15, 22:48 PST
Scheduled - The Platform external SSL certificate is getting expired and cert rotation is taking place.
There will be no downtime for this activity. But there can be a small network glitch at the time of renewal which is very

Refer to the KB article for more details on certificate

https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/FAQ-IICS-changing-the-certificate-providers?language=en_US

item.title: Issue with Mass Ingestion on US West 1 GCP Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 19, 17:52 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 19, 13:15 PST
Monitoring - We implemented a fix for this issue. All services are operating normally and we are monitoring it.

Feb 19, 12:21 PST
Investigating - We observed an issue with access to Mass Ingestion Files, Database Ingestion and Streaming Ingestion service in US West 1 GCP Services. All other services are operating normally.

Our team is actively working to resolve this issue on priority, and we will ensure to update the status page accordingly.

Next update by 1.30 PM PT.

item.title: Notification for applying a patch on all PODs for Snowflake Data Cloud Connector
item.content:encoded:
Feb 16, 04:30 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 16, 02:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 15, 01:55 PST
Scheduled - Snowflake plans to rollout 2024_01 bundle related to sequences and columns, which might impact your existing Snowflake Data Cloud mapping tasks that are based on a mapping in SQL ELT mode configured with the Sequence Generator transformation. For more details about the Snowflake update, see https://docs.snowflake.com/en/release-notes/bcr-bundles/2024_01/bcr-1483?css
Snowflake Data Cloud Connector patch will make sure your mappings are not impacted because of the Snowflake update and continue to work like before. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and it will not impact any running jobs or services.

Action needed: None

Attention: This will deploy a new version of the Data Integration Service.

item.title: Change in Package Dependency Manager IP Addresses and Domain for IDMC- AP SouthEast 1, EM West 1, Canada Central 1, AP NorthEast 2, UK, EM SouthEast 1 Azure, AP NorthEast 1 Azure, US West 1 Azure, US West 3 Azure, and EM Central 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 22:01 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 15, 21:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 8, 12:07 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Intelligent Data Management is implementing a crucial enhancement to our infrastructure by introducing a unified Global Package Dependency Manager. This Global Package Dependency Manager will facilitate the seamless download of the latest Secure Agent packages across all IDMC PODs.

This update will retire the old regional package dependency manager and redirect all traffic to the new unified Global Package Dependency Manager. These changes will not impact the IP addresses for the Identity Service or other IDMC services.

To avoid any service disruption, allow the following IP addresses or domain (depending on your network policy) through your organization‚Äôs firewall before February 15, 2023.

New IP Addresses:

Primary IP addresses:
34.215.138.77
34.217.216.210
44.228.239.240

Disaster Recovery (DR) IP addresses:
34.225.222.175
44.215.191.102
174.129.76.131

New FQDN for Global Package Dependency Manager: [https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com|https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com/]

To ensure access to the new Global Package Dependency Manager, please test access from the secure agent via the following URL: [https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com/package-manager/mgmtapi/version]

A test utility is available for testing purposes and can be run directly from the secure agent machine. For detailed information, please refer to the FAQ: [https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/Change-in-Package-Dependency-Manager-IP-Addresses-and-Domain-for-IDMC-all-pods?language=en_US]

item.title: Intermittent issue accessing Data Integration Taskflow in designer on US East 4 POD
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 11:42 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 15, 05:35 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 15, 05:14 PST
Investigating - We are experiencing intermittent issues accessing the Data Integration Taskflow on the USE4 POD. This issue is affecting both the designer and the runtime, and we are actively working to resolve the issue.

item.title: We noticed an intermittent issue on the IICS EM West 1 in CAI
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 06:47 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 14, 23:29 PST
Monitoring - The issue was resolved around 11:27 PM PT, and service is currently operating normally. While there haven't been any process failures.
We're actively monitoring the services to ensure continued smooth operation.

Feb 14, 22:14 PST
Investigating - We noticed an intermittent issue on the IICS EM West 1 pod while accessing the Application Integration console, designer, and CAI schedulers. The issue is currently being investigated on priority and we shall keep the status page updated.
Please contact Global Customer Support for any queries. May get errors like below:

1. The application is not configured correctly by using the org ID ''.
2. 504 gateway Timed Out error.

item.title: Issue downloading the Session logs for Cloud CDI-e services in EM West 1 POD.
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 04:29 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 15, 03:53 PST
Monitoring - The issue is resolved and users should be able to download the session logs.

Feb 15, 03:42 PST
Investigating - We are observing an issue while downloading the session logs in the Cloud CDI-e Services.
There is no impact on mapping design or on the runtime. All the other services are operating normally.

item.title: Cloud Application Integration Public Certificate renewal on EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 14, 23:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 14, 19:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 8, 09:06 PST
Scheduled - The public SSL certificates for the Cloud Application Integration is scheduled for renewal on February 14, 2024, between 7:00 PM and 11:00 PM PST specifically for services on EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services. If your client application enforces comprehensive certificate chain validation, these renewed certificates can be integrated into its trust store. The article links below provide SSL certificates that will be used for renewal. These can be imported to your client's trust store, alongside any existing certificates you might already possess, if needed.

Please find the article links with Certificates:
https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/Cloud-Application-Integration-Server-certificate-for-Azure-EMSE-1-POD
